alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, Portage Lake, New Canada, Cross Lake, Madawaska Lake, Fish River Lake, Lille, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Stockholm, Winterville, Westmanland, Soldier Pond, Daigle and Guerette. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
